docs.lead_paragraph: Same-sex marriage rights were not, as is commonly believed, a natural consequence of the gay liberation movement that emerged in the late ’60s.

headline.main: The Long Road to Marriage Equality
headline.print_headline: The Long Road to Marriage Equality

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by American studies and history Prof George Chauncey relates history leading up to Supreme Court's landmark decision to strike down Defense of Marriage Act; contends quest for same-sex marriage rights was not a natural consequence of the gay liberation movement that emerged in the late 1960s, but was instead a consequence of the AIDS epidemic in the 1980s.
docs.snippet: Same-sex marriage rights were not, as is commonly believed, a natural consequence of the gay liberation movement that emerged in the late ’60s.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Live Analysis of Supreme Court Decision on Affirmative Action

docs.abstract: The Supreme Court ruled on Thursday on Fisher v. University of Texas at Austin, a case concerning affirmative action. Times reporters and editors are analyzing the decision and its implications, as well as the public’s reaction to it.
docs.snippet: The Supreme Court ruled on Thursday on Fisher v. University of Texas at Austin, a case concerning affirmative action. Times reporters and editors are analyzing the decision and its implications, as well as the public’s reaction to it.
